reviews.title: Plush but "Stuffy" and Expensive Hotel
reviews.text: I stayed for 3 nights at the Villa Magna Hotel Madrid. Got a Junior Suite. The location of the hotel is reasonable good - just behind a large shopping mall and one block off the main shopping street of Madrid. Within 300 metres of the Metro Station.

reviews.title: best hotel I ever stayed in
reviews.text: The exterior of the hotel is unremarkable and "dated" but once you enter, you will realise that this is a 5 star quality hotel with high quality furnishings and decor. The hotel was refurbised in 2009 and is well maintained, modern and plush. The room was charming with "light" colours and the furniture and bed were excellent. The room TV was most unusual as it doubled up as a wall mirror!
Housekeeping was prompt and efficient and effective, as was the room service.
reviews.title: 5 Star Service with a smile

reviews.text: In terms of hotel amenities, there was not much - a smallish gym but no swimming pool.
reviews.title: Like the stay

reviews.text: The concierge service was efficient and very effective. However, overall, you don't get the feeling that the hotel's staff are warm and friendly. They seem more concerned with "getting the job done". Nothing wrong with that of course, but for the hefty price paid you should expect better.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has such a good feeling about it. The service is top notch, warm and friendly and discreet. I believe the hotel is privately owned and it shows. I was thoroughly comfortable throughout my short stay in Madrid.
reviews.title: Believe all the good reviews here ..........................

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel decor is wonderful, contempory but not in a clinical minimalist way, it is luxurious and warm and in no way 'corporate'. The 'Gaudiesque' stained glass windows at the staircase is beautiful especially on the lobby level where it is lit up from behind.
reviews.title: One of the best luxury city hotels in the world - and the best in Madrid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are very restful and I found them to be of a good size compared to some city hotels. Bed a trifle hard for me but this is a personal thing, the bedlinen is the smoothest softest cotton.
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.text: Location is great, walk out of the back of the hotel and you have Corte Ingles and some great shopping on your doorstep. Sights are within easy reach.
reviews.title: Great hotel! High quality! Recomended!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think my handbag was undeserving of the little table provided for it each time we took a refreshment! Probably a good place to take a Chanel.
reviews.title: High quality, good location - smallish rooms - food and wine expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed at a couple of hotels in Madrid, and can honestly say the Villa Magna trumps the competition.
reviews.title: Best in Madrid

reviews.text: First of all there's the location. The building stands proud on Castellana, back to back with Calle Serrano's "El Corte Ingles" department store. You're bang in the middle of Madrid's high end shopping and dining district, and can enjoy both Salamanca and Chamberi on foot quite easily. You're also far enough (15 minutes by foot) from the Prado to avoid the first time tourists that plague both the Palace and the Ritz.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel, Perfect location, Perfect Staff

reviews.text: The hotel was recently renovated and is a triumph of civilized elegance. The owners are of course Portuguese, of Ritz Lisbon fame. The main lobby is just lovely, and there's a very nice terrace in he back. The design is classic contemporary, reminiscent of some Rocco Forte properties.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel!

reviews.text: I probably stayed at the hotels smallest room but it was big enough; very elegant and comfortable, all stucco moldings and deco inspired furniture. The bathroom is divided in two areas, the first with double vanity and closet, the second with toilet and bathtub, which doubles as a shower.
reviews.title: Excellent, top notch, white glove service hotel

reviews.text: Service is very very swift and courteous. 2 out of 3 non-food requests were delivered in a matter of seconds. Yes, seconds, as in under a minute. Very impressive.
reviews.title: Villa Magna- The Best Hotel in all of Madrid

reviews.text: The hotel is magnificent. Our room was large, impeccably decorated and every amenity was brand new. The staff is very friendly and helpful and the fitness center had new equipment. The location is perfect as it is in the center of Madrid. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Madrid. It ranks in my opinion as one of the best hotels I have had the pleasure of visiting.
reviews.title: The hotel is magnificent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a few nights and was delighted with our room!
reviews.title: Stunning Rooms, Great location... shame about the snobby people!!!

reviews.text: I have stayed in many 5 star hotels in Spain and not all are on par with the real 5 star hotesl you get in England. This however was :0).
reviews.title: 5 Stars and More

reviews.text: Great location, all the best designer shops, it's just like being in Bond street but soooo much better and cleaner! The beds were so nice I had trouble getting up!
reviews.title: One of the best hotels I've ever stayed at - Solid 5 star property

reviews.text: Great Asian restaurant the staff were amazing.
reviews.title: not a real 5 star
